intro: Cusparia cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
